intro: Sabicea bicarpellata, commonly known as the two-chambered sabicea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and often nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets, and it produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pale yellow or greenish in color. The fruit is a legume pod containing two seeds, which is a key identifying feature of the species.
